alert.note: Alert for Watauga; Wilkes (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 10:54PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Wilkes and southeastern Watauga Counties through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1054 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Deep Gap, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Boomer... Buck... Elkville... Maple Springs... and Darby. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
